name: 陳維昌
objective:
The course aims to provide an introduction to linear algebra which is a useful and fundamental mathematical tool for EE students. The course contains the following topics:

1. Matrices, Vectors and Systems of Linear Equations 
2. Matrices and Linear Transformations 
3. Determinants 
4. Subspaces and Their Properties 
5. Eigenvalues, Eigenvectors and Diagonalization 
6. Orthogonality 
7. Vector Spaces
schedule:
Week 01. Matrices, Vectors and Systems of Linear Equations 
Week 02. Matrices, Vectors and Systems of Linear Equations 
Week 03. Matrices, Vectors and Systems of Linear Equations 
Week 04. Matrices and Linear Transformations 
Week 05. Matrices and Linear Transformations 
Week 06. Matrices and Linear Transformations 
Week 07. Determinants  
Week 08. Determinants 
Week 09. Midterm Exam
Week 10. Subspaces and Their Properties 
Week 11. Subspaces and Their Properties 
Week 12. Eigenvalues, Eigenvectors and Diagonalization 
Week 13. Eigenvalues, Eigenvectors and Diagonalization 
Week 14. Orthogonality 
Week 15. Orthogonality 
Week 16. Orthogonality
Week 17. Vector Spaces
Week 18. Final Exam

The schedule may be adjusted if necessary.
materials: L. E. Spence, A. J. Insel, and S. H. Friedberg, Elementary Linear Algebra: A Matrix Approach, 2nd edition, Pearson Education, 2008.
